properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong northwesterly winds will whip up snow and give blizzard conditions over these communities today. Conditions should improve through the evening. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-18T01:11:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T09:12:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1259845923.2020
Area: Ivujivik, Akulivik, Puvirnituq, Inukjuak, Umiujaq, Kuujjuarapik, Salluit, Sanikiluaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High winds to 90 km/h will persist until this morning. The winds will weaken in the morning, but will remain strong through the day. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T14:43:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T05:45:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3002279755.2020
Area: Sanikiluaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The area of dense fog has dissipated in most areas, but is expected to reform this evening and last until the morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T13:59:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-16T22:01:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3190142729.2020

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong gusty winds are expected this morning. A rapidly deepening area of low pressure will pass north of Vancouver Island this morning while a fast moving cold front crosses the south coast. In advance of the cold front, strong sustained southeasterly winds are expected for coastal areas in proximity to the Strait of Georgia and Haro Strait. As the front races across the area, widespread and powerful gusty southerly winds will occur. Gusts in excess of 90 km/h are possible. Winds will ease considerably following the passage of the cold front but will remain gusty into this afternoon. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T21:59:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T08:07:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3737609577.2020
Area: East Vancouver Island - Duncan to Nanaimo, Greater Victoria, Howe Sound, Metro Vancouver - North Shore including West Vancouver and North Vancouver, Metro Vancouver - central including the City of Vancouver Burnaby and New Westminster, Metro Vancouver - northeast including Coquitlam and Maple Ridge, Metro Vancouver - southeast including Surrey and Langley, Metro Vancouver - southwest including Richmond and Delta, Fraser Valley - west including Abbotsford, Southern Gulf Islands
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Flurries and local snow squalls Tuesday into Wednesday morning. Flurries and local snow squalls are expected to begin Tuesday late morning and continue through the day into the night. Local snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm in 12 hours are possible. Strong winds along with local blowing snow will reduce visibilities at times and make travel difficult. Snow squalls will taper off Wednesday morning. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T12:17:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-16T20:18:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2140521426.2020
Area: London - Parkhill - Eastern Middlesex County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Listowel - Milverton - Northern Perth County, Goderich - Bluewater - Southern Huron County, Stratford - Mitchell - Southern Perth County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Lake effect snow today through early Wednesday morning; poor visibility and locally 10 to 20 cm of snow expected. Hazards: Whiteout conditions in heavy and blowing snow Snowfall amounts of 10 to 20 cm locally Timing: Heavy flurries will start later this morning and last through tonight. The worst snow squall conditions are expected later this afternoon and this evening. Impacts: Motorists should be prepared for hazardous winter driving conditions. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-18T01:20:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T09:21:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3412876306.2020
Area: London - Parkhill - Eastern Middlesex County, Woodstock - Tillsonburg - Oxford County, Brantford - County of Brant, Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Listowel - Milverton - Northern Perth County, Goderich - Bluewater - Southern Huron County, Stratford - Mitchell - Southern Perth County, Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County, Kitchener - Cambridge - Region of Waterloo
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense low pressure system tracking northeast over Hudson Strait early this morning is giving strong north winds to Coral Harbour. North to northwest winds as high as 60 gusting 80 km/h will cause blowing snow and reduced visibility today with gradual improvement expected tonight. The potential still exists for blizzard conditions today with visibilities at times 400 metres or less. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-18T01:22:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T09:23:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3556171322.2020
Area: Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong northwesterly winds will bring blizzard conditions beginning this evening. Conditions are expected to improve Wednesday morning. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-18T01:11:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T09:12:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3645919507.2020
Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake, Quaqtaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Visibilities will be near zero at times today with the snow and the strong winds. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T22:59:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T09:04:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3175727542.2020
Area: James Bay and La Grande River, LG Quatre - Laforge and Fontanges
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today. This Winter Weather Travel Advisory is changed from a Snow Squall Watch that was previously in effect. Brief periods of low visibility in heavy flurries are expected; locally 5 to 15 cm of snow is possible. Hazards: Brief periods of low visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow Snowfall amounts of 5 to 15 cm locally Timing: Heavy flurries will last through this morning. More heavy flurries are possible this afternoon and early this evening. Impacts: Motorists should be prepared for hazardous winter driving conditions. The morning commute may be impacted. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-18T00:48:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T08:49:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2103254442.2020
Area: Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake, Orillia - Lagoon City - Washago, Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, Bruce Peninsula - Sauble Beach - Tobermory, Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County, Hanover - Dundalk - Southern Grey County, Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Areas of dense fog continue to persist over portions of central Saskatchewan this afternoon as light easterly winds under a ridge of high pressure impact the region. Visibilities have improved in some areas but will likely drop again this evening. This fog advisory will likely be expanded as the evening progresses and conditions are monitored. Visibilities will improve overnight into Tuesday morning when winds increase. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T13:19:54-00:00

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Areas of dense fog persist over portions of southern Saskatchewan early this morning. Strengthening southeast winds should start lifting the fog later this morning in most areas. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A low pressure centre is intensifying rapidly and moving quickly towards north Vancouver Island tonight. Over exposed coastal areas of north Vancouver Island and the Central Coast, southeast winds 90 gusting to 110 km/hr will develop overnight & early Tuesday morning. By Tuesday afternoon winds will shift to southwest 90 gusting to 110 km/hr over exposed coastal locations. Winds are expected to fall below warning criteria later Tuesday afternoon. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T15:41:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-16T23:42:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3535097036.2020
Area: North Vancouver Island, Central Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. Snow will start in northwestern Saskatchewan late today and move eastward during the night. The heaviest snow is expected to be through the province near noon Wednesday. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-18T02:28:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T10:29:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3625421513.2020
Area: Uranium City - Camsell Portage, Fond-du-Lac, Stony Rapids and Black Lake, Cluff Lake Mine, La Loche and Clearwater River Prov. Park, Cree Lake - Key Lake, Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay, Southend - Brabant Lake - Kinoosao
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Heavy snow will continue over the Peace River District then spread to Fort Nelson late this morning. The snow will continue through tonight giving total accumulations ranging from 15 to 25 cm. Heavy snow will ease to light snow this morning over the Peace River District and by Wednesday morning over the Fort Nelson region. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-18T03:36:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T11:37:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2907512179.2020
Area: B.C. South Peace River, B.C. North Peace River, Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A warm front will cause heavy snow tomorrow in northwestern Alberta. The snow is expected to start near noon in the Manning area, in the afternoon in the High Level area and in the evening in the Fort Chipewyan area. A total of 10-15 cm of snow is expected. The heaviest snow should stay north of the town of Peace River, where just 2-4 cm expected. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T14:35:07-00:00

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong southeast winds of 60 to 80 km/h will develop overnight over East Vancouver Island and the Sunshine Coast as a strong low approaches the south coast. Winds will ease around midday Tuesday as the low moves inland and weakens. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T15:39:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-16T23:40:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4041860064.2020
Area: East Vancouver Island - Nanoose Bay to Fanny Bay, East Vancouver Island - Courtenay to Campbell River, Sunshine Coast - Gibsons to Earls Cove, Sunshine Coast - Saltery Bay to Powell River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow combined with blowing snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T12:18:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T09:20:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2796391802.2020

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong northwesterly winds will whip up snow and give blizzard conditions over these communities. Conditions are expected to improve Tuesday morning. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T15:59:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T03:02:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1055110075.2020

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 30 cm expected Tuesday. A deep Pacific low pressure system will move northward toward the North Coast on Tuesday. This system is forecast to spread snow at times heavy to the region by early morning. The snow will persist all day and then finally end late Tuesday evening as the low moves to the north. In addition, strong north winds of 50 km/h gusting to 70 will give widespread areas of blowing snow. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T20:45:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-17T04:46:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4109387079.2020
Area: North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong southeast winds of 70 to 100 km/h will develop tonight over West Vancouver Island as a strong low approaches the south coast. Winds will veer to southwest 50 to 70 km/h behind the low Tuesday morning and ease further Tuesday afternoon. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T15:47:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-16T23:48:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0589712617.2020
Area: West Vancouver Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A pacific storm will bring heavy snow to the region tonight and Tuesday. Heavy snow will begin early this evening over 100 Mile, Highway 97 - Begbie Summit, and Chilcotin then end overnight. Snow will spread to Stuart - Nechako late this evening and persist through midday Tuesday before tapering off. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T15:24:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-16T23:25:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1134709389.2020
Area: Highway 97 - Clinton to 100 Mile House via Begbie Summit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are expected to end this morning as winds weaken. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A Pacific storm will approach northern British Columbia tonight and bring heavy snow and strong winds to the region on Tuesday. 10 to 15 cm of snow is expected during the day plus and additional 10 to 15 cm Tuesday night. Gusty northeasterly winds will develop Tuesday morning and persist until at least Tuesday evening, leading to reduced visibilities in blowing snow. Conditions should improve by early Wednesday morning as the storm system exits the region. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-17T15:17:59-00:00

Area: Highway 97 - Pine Pass

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A deep Pacific low will move northward toward the north coast on Tuesday. Consequently, strong northerly outflow winds of 80 to 100 km/h are expected near Portland inlet Tuesday morning and early afternoon. Winds will ease in the afternoon as the low moves inland. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
